results.headline: More to Life
results.summary_short: Robert Kane Pappas’s digressive documentary “To Age or Not to Age” features scientists working on ways to control longevity.

results.headline: This Time the Dream’s on Me
results.summary_short: In Christopher Nolan’s “Inception” a specialist in corporate mental espionage and his co-workers penetrate the minds of their slumbering targets.

results.summary_short: Nicolas Cage stars in a tale of supernatural powers, an ancient conflict and an N.Y.U. student with a crush.

results.headline: A Boy’s Slice of Paradise Is Time Alone With Dad
results.summary_short: In “Alamar,” by Pedro González-Rubio, a boy takes the journey of a lifetime with his Mexican father.

results.headline: Meet the Sperm Donor: Modern Family Ties
results.summary_short: In Lisa Cholodenko’s movie, teenagers and their two moms have dinner, and lots more, with a newly found biological father.

results.headline: He’s Off to Join the Circus
results.summary_short: Jacques Rivette’s “Around a Small Mountain” is as transporting and graceful as a ride in a balloon.

results.headline: Revisiting the Irascible RV Pitchman Who Went Viral

results.headline: Like Shooting Humans in a Jungly Alien Barrel
results.summary_short: Nimrod Antal’s “Predators,” a spinoff of John McTiernan’s 1987 “Predator,” is less karmic morality tale than pulpy cartoon.

results.summary_short: “The Last Airbender” can serve as a reminder of how difficult it can be to inaugurate a fantasy-action franchise.

results.headline: Revenge on the Bully, Silently, in Japan
results.summary_short: Yasujiro Ozu’s “I Was Born, but...” is one of those silent black-and-white old movies that makes the subsequent advances in the medium look redundant.

results.headline: Anarchic Imagination vs. Humdrum
